breweries.brewery_description: Australian Beer Company is a new brewery focused on celebrating Australian flavours, 50/50 equity holding by CCA and Casella Family Brands meaning that our great beers and ciders are being sold and distributed through CCA.
Brewery, Bar & Kitchen in Royal Park
A small gypsy brewing company based in Sydney's inner west.

In 1980, Ken Grossman built a small brewery in the city of Chico, California. To this day, premium ingredients and time-honored brewing techniques make Sierra Nevada ales and lagers truly exceptional beers.

venue.venue_name: Sierra Nevada Brewing Company - Mills River

breweries.brewery_description: Founded 2004 within an 800 square foot garage in Red Hook, Brooklyn NYC.

Founded by Greg Koch and Steve Wagner in 1996, San Diego-based Stone Brewing is the 9th largest craft brewer in the United States. Stone has been listed on the Inc. 500 | 5000 Fastest Growing Private Companies list 11 times, and has been called the âAll-time Top Brewery on Planet Earthâ by BeerAdvocate magazine twice. 

The multifaceted company will be the first American craft brewer to independently build, own and operate a brewery in Europe, and is also building a production brewery and destination restaurant in Richmond, Virginia. Brewing at both locations is anticipated to begin in spring 2016. Known for its bold, flavorful and largely hop-centric beers, Stone has earned a reputation for brewing outstanding, unique beers while maintaining an unwavering commitment to sustainability, business ethics, philanthropy and the art of brewing.

Canberra based craft brewery and tavern on ANU campus. 16 beer taps all brewed on site (including 4 handpumped English real ales). Follow us on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter. #wigandpenbrewery

Call (02) 6248 0171 for more info or visit us at the ANU School of Music, Llewellyn Hall, William Herbert Pl, Canberra, ACT.

A micro brewery with cellar door based in the Shire, open Thur, Fri and Sat for tastings and sales. Bringing ales with flavour to our local community and to beer lovers everywhere.

Combining a core range of tasty quenchers and a multitude of extremely limited batch releases to excite the more adventurous tastebuds.

Having met on the school run many moons ago, Nick Newey and Pat McInerney bonded over a mutual love of fishing and boating, which eventually led the pair to tinkering in homebrewing together. After years of experimentation, and with neither satisfied in their 9-5, they decided to turn their passion into profession. And so, Willie the Boatman was born.

With no experience in running, let alone building a brewery, Nick and Pat started from scratch with little else to keep them going other than a belief in their beer, a belief in their brand, and an unwavering support from their local community.

Countless buckets of blood, sweat and tears (not to mention many a late night beer) later, the brewery finally opened its doors to the public in 2015, and we havenât looked back since. With community at the core of our business model, Willie the Boatman have stayed true to our original homebrewing ethos and remain dedicated to producing good, clean beer using an uncomplicated approach.

Willie the Boatman now operates its own tasting room, open Thursdays through Saturdays, as well as supplying beer to numerous pubs, hotels and bottle shops in and around the Inner West. Who knows, perhaps one day weâll even have earned ourselves the same legendary status as our namesake, William Kerr.

reviews.beers: It's a fairly small range which hits all the standard favorite styles plus a few more on the adventurous side but overall it's a high quality range of beers.
reviews.venue: Situated in what seems like an old warehouse it's got that industrial feel. The corrugated iron walls tend to cause the bar to warm up significantly in the summer which gives a nice excuse to get yourself another beer.

breweries.brewery_description: Kingdom Brewery is a boutique brewery located in Phnom Penh. We are the only Cambodian brewery operating in the premium segment and enjoying a significant presence in foreign markets.
Yulli's Brews makes good beer in Sydney, Australia. Each brew is meticulously crafted to have it's own memorable personality, just like a good mate.

Magical modern beers in cask, keg and bottle for a new wave of discerning beer drinkers... Beer the same but different, conjured for flavour...

Magic Rock Tap:
Mon: Closed
Tues: 4pm - 10pm
Wed: 4pm - 10.00pm
Thur: 4pm - 10.00pm
Fri: 1pm - 11.00pm
Sat: 12pm - 11.00pm
Sun: 12pm - 9.00pm

Weâre the UKâs largest privately owned brewing company. Our name is on many distinctive beers and over 200 pubs. Weâve been brewing and serving for over 130 years.

We have a proud history of bringing innovation to the brewing industry. From our flourishing international business, which has introduced enthusiastic consumers in over 40 countries to the delights of British beer, to our inventive marketing thatâs helping to make ale modern, weâre always looking out for new products, new experiences and â best of all â new customers.

Our two loves have come together to form BentSpoke Brewing Co, a microbrewery and taphouse driven by a desire to provide you with a world-class craft beer experience.

One of the biggest beer fonts in the country is hardly enough to contain the imagination of our brewer. Competition for one of our 18 taps is tight with cask conditioned real ales, lagers, seasonal one-off batches, barrel aged new world bent styles & hand crushed ciders all vying for a spot at the bar.

Our 18 different varieties of beer and cider are all lovingly brewed on premises by one of Australiaâs most awarded brewers. Some change with the seasons, some are one-offs, others will stay the course.

We want you to fall in love with our brews and maybe even take one home in a BentSpoke Traveller! The Traveller is a two-litre refillable, insulated and pressurised container that allows you to enjoy brewery-fresh tap beer wherever life may take you. Ditch the esky & ice, and keep your seriously good beer, seriously cold, at the hottest of BBQâs.

The tale of two brothers is one of determination, perseverance, getting stuck in and having a go.
They grabbed hold of every opportunity and definitely werenât afraid of getting their hands dirty.

Born to Irish parents, James and John soon learned that the luck of the Irish was a myth.

Everything they achieved in life was earned, not handed to them. They didnât follow trails; they blazed them. And success didnât come easy.

They suffered loads of setbacks on their path to creating a brewing legend; setbacks that wouldâve made many men give up â but not these brothers. They gritted their teeth, rolled up their sleeves and kept going.

From introducing new beers, to sponsoring sporting and community events, the brothersâ have-a-go spirit has always been at the forefront of everything we do. Itâs them we have to thank for who we are today, and weâll never forget that.

Barossa Valley Brewingâs genesis was far from the lush rolling hills of the Barossa, but in the far away shores of the United States. Denham, our brewery founder, was in University in 1990, (supposed to be) studying Economics and Business but instead, was falling in love with craft beer.  He spent much time with passionate brewers there, falling more deeply in love with this amazing beverage.  Upon coming home, he did what any sensible person would do, he started a brewery.

We choose the Barossa, as it has an adherence to quality and a culture of experimentation which has allowed it to produce some of the planetâs best beverages. We have learned from the talented people who work and live here to produce world class beers, that sit alongside world class wines.

We work with the best local ingredients â whether that be Barossa roasted coffee, local picked cherries or lemongrass tended by local producers.

All of us at BVB are foodies and enjoy nothing better than pairing great beer with great food.   We wanted to share this joy so in 2011 we moved the entire Brewery about 10 kms north to Tanunda, and started a restaurant and have been sharing the joy ever since.

This is just the start of the story. We keep working hard, experimenting harder and are enjoying great beer with an increasing band of friends.

Nomad's, members of a community that roam from one location to another. An experience in beer, beer designed for adventures in taste. All our beers are naturally bottle and keg conditioned and proudly brewed and packaged at our Brewery on Sydney's Northern Beaches. Nomad's Never Settle! (except to brew great beer!)

An independently owned brewery based on the Northern Beaches of Sydney. 12 beers on tap, finger lickin grub, live music and all beers available for takeaway in growlers or CANimals. Awarded Champion Medium Brewery, Champion IPA and Champion Pale Ale in the Craft Beer Awards 2015. 

Our Modus Operandi is simple. Beer First. No Shortcuts.

Brewed and canned in Los Angeles, Golden Roadâs year-round offerings include Point the Way IPA, Heal the Bay IPA, 329 Lager Golden Road Hefeweizen, Get Up Offa That Brown and Wolf Among Weeds IPA. Along with the core beers, Golden Road brewers are constantly experimenting with the freshest ingredients through a collection of rotating, seasonal and limited-edition brews including the Custom IPA Series, a line-up of diverse, hop-forward IPAs.

venue.venue_name: The Pub at Golden Road Brewing

breweries.brewery_description: Karl Strauss Brewing Company has pioneered the San Diego beer scene since 1989 with innovative beer releases like Aurora Hoppyalis IPA, Mosaic Session Ale, Big Barrel IIPA, and Wreck Alley Imperial Stout. The brewery has won over 80 medals since 2009 and its Red Trolley Ale is one of the most award-winning beers in the world. The company is currently ranked #45 on the list of the countryâs top craft breweries with sole distribution in California. For more information visit www.karlstrauss.com. Cheers!

The Akasha Brewing team is made up of like-minded, passionate beer enthusiasts. Our culture is pretty simple: brew the beer that we love to drink and, most importantly, have some fun while weâre doing it. Basically, for all of us here at Akasha, beer is our way of life.

Our small batch beer is lovingly handcrafted using the highest quality natural brewing ingredients sourced from around the world. The beer we make is of the highest quality standard without any chemicals or preservatives ensuring that you will have the finest beer produced in Canberra.

Pact (noun)

An agreement; a compact; a covenant.

From Latin pactum (âsomething agreed upon"Â), from paciscere (âto agree"Â).


In 2015, three mates made a pact to brew great beer and never compromise on flavour, quality and creativity.

Now Pact Beer Co is a reality and weâre giving you the opportunity to join the Pact, too.
Microbrewery on the edge of the Attersee.

Letâs get this straight â We are whatâs called a gypsy brewery (or Pyrate/Nomad/Contract/Gold Digger Brewery). This means that we donât own our own brewing equipment, but brew at others instead. We do this because we think it is the absolute best way to ensure the highest quality, the widest variety and continually being able to reinvent ourself and the beers we brew. We are gypsies and we are proud of it.

So in short: If you want to visit our brewery, then it is not because we are unpolite snobs that we say no.
Aiming to create interesting, unusual, & sometimes challenging beers for Inner West beer lovers!
A contract brewery run by Liquorland, a subsidiary of Coles Supermarkets.

Weâre obsessed with great IPA. Some would call it a fixation, and so we did.

After a number of IPA sabbaticals to the west coast of the USA, we were fascinated by how the brewers have taken this style and made it their own. They showcased just how fantastic fresh IPA's can be.

We think IPA's are at their best when they are fresh, that big flavoursome hop aroma is just amazing when the beer is only days old. On the flip-side, they can be disappointing with a bit of age on them, they lose that awesome floral hop character and are not always at their best by the time we get to drink them at home.

So we set up Fixation Brewing Co. to be fixated on one thing, making the best IPA's possible. Itâs backed by people who know beer and fronted by a man who has a fanatical obsession with the style. We had an inkling that there was room in the Australian beer landscape for a beer business that is purely focused on well made, fresh American style IPA, and Tom Delmont is the passionate IPA enthusiast to deliver it to the IPA fanatics of Australia.

MARTIN AND I (JAMES) WERE BORED OF THE INDUSTRIALLY BREWED LAGERS AND STUFFY ALES THAT DOMINATED THE UK BEER MARKET.

We decided the best way to fix this undesirable predicament was to brew our own. Consequently in April 2007 BrewDog was born.

Both only 24 at the time, we leased a building in Fraserburgh, got some scary bank loans, spent all our money on stainless steel and started making some hardcore craft beers.

We brewed tiny batches, filled bottles by hand and sold our beers at local markets and out of the back of our beat up old van.

Our biggest mission when we set up BrewDog was to make other people as passionate about great craft beer as we are. And that is still our biggest mission today.

Opened in 2015, The Katoomba Brewing Company is located in the old Power Station on the grounds of The Carrington Hotel. Access is Via Parke Street. The Brewery currently produces 3 styles of beer which are all available on tap in various venues around Katoomba. The brewery is available for private functions but will open a new bar and restaurant in 2016/2017.
Born out of a love affair with hoppy beer.

The Lord Nelson Brewery Hotel is Sydneys Oldest  licensed hotel, located in the historic rocks precinct and home of Australias oldest pub brewery. The Lord is recognised around the world for its award winning beers, food and accommodation, which allows our guests to experience the amenities of a modern establishment with the grandeur and colonial appeal of one of the worlds most unique hotels.

BeerHere Brewery was founded by Danish brewer, Christian Skovdal Andersen, in 2004. In an effort to share his adventures and love for beers, Christian, built the Beerhere Brewing Company. The brewery is known for its two famous beer styles; the Dark Hops and Morke.

Dark Hops is an American Strong Ale, characterized by black appearance and hoppy quality. It is brewed in roasted barley, British Maris Otter malt, juicy Zeus and Saaz hops. Morke is a Pumpernickel Porter made up of rye, barley, sugar, yeast, spices and hops. Beerhere Brewery is slowly being introduced in the U.S.  It had its first launch in Atlanta, Georgia back in 2009.

Our famous beer began with a trip across Europe, when Goose Island founder (and unabashed beer lover) John Hall took a tour across the continent. Pint by pint, he savored the styles and selections of brews in every region, and thought to himself, âAmerica deserves some damn fine beer like this, too.â

Craft brewing wasnât widely known at the time, but upon return from his European sojourn, John set out to change all that. He settled down in his hometown of Chicagoâa city perfect for craft beer, with rapidly evolving tastes and the largest system of fresh water on the planet. And then he got to brewing.

First he made some stellar beer. Then he invited his consumers in to watch his process at the brewery, bringing them behind the scenes every step of the way. The result was a new fascination with craft brewing, and beer that not only catered to peopleâs tastes, but challenged them as well.

That was back in 1988, and we havenât slowed down since. By 1995, Johnâs beer had become so popular that he decided to open a larger brewery, along with a bottling plant to keep up with demand.  Today, what was once one manâs pint-filled dream has become the Goose Island empire you know and love..

The Balmain Brewing Company was launched in 2010 in honour of tradition, mates and pub culture. The Company is owned by a group of passionate mates, locals to Balmain, with the following vision: 

â¢ Becoming Sydneyâs own iconic local beer company, representing tradition, mates and pub culture 

â¢ Brewing hand-crafted quality beer 

â¢ Having the majority of pubs in Sydney pouring a Balmain Brewing Company beer 

â¢ Establish a Balmain Brewing Company microbrewery/restaurant on the peninsula. 

The mates dreamed up the plan while drinking over the years in each of Balmainâs 17 pubs, and hearing about the Balmain Brewery of last century and the 55 pubs of the 1800âs!
Real ale, hop garden, tastings & modern beer-friendly food. Open Fri-Sun 11-7 +more in summer. A beer oasis in a sea of wine.  Nestled in a peaceful bush setting in the beautiful Mornington Peninsula

Boatrocker Brewery is an independent brewery in the south-east of Melbourne (Braeside), Australia. Our beer philosophy is pretty simple... Make the best beer possible using the best possible ingredients. We're always striving to create new and wonderful beers appealing to both newcomers on the craft beer journey and the more seasoned craft beer traveller. We hope you enjoy the ride!
In 2002, Feral Brewing Co opened its doors in the Swan Valley, WA's oldest wine region - Brewing beer to be deliberately and distinctively Feral

Twenty years ago six brothers from Sydney with a passion for craft beer and hospitality started taking small steps towards creating a range of signature Australian craft brews.

Along the way these steps have become giant leaps as they have consistently produced award winning craft beers and distributed them nationwide and even overseas.

From a small Brewery in the Hunter Valley to a state of the art micro brewery in Northwest Sydney the familyâs philosophy has always been â Fresh, Pure, Australian.

Based in Marrickville, Sydney. 

Tasting bar at the brewery - see website for hours. 

1/391 Enmore Road, Marrickville, 2204.

Founded on Sydneyâs Northern Beaches in 2011, Dad & Dave's Brewing is an independently owned and operated family business (Dad, Dave, Mum, Jess, Scott and James).
 
Dad (John) and Dave are qualified brewers who understand customer wants and needs. We focus on using the traditional ingredients of malt, hops, water and yeast, and then combine these with some innovative ingredients and brewing techniques to live up to our motto:
 
"We make beer, delicious beer!"

Olympic Brewery S.A. is a purely Greek and fast evolving company that was set up in January 2010. 

It owns the lager FIX Hellas brand, the first and most historical Greek beer; the premium lager FIX Dark brand, which created a new category in the domestic market of dark beer and the premium wheat beer FIX Royale, which constitutes a high quality Hellenic proposal in the Weiss beer category. 

The ultra-modern privately owned brew house of Olympic Brewery, where all the products are produced, is located in Ritsona area, in Evia.
Since its establishment, Olympic Brewery has demonstrated that, alongside its investment program, it focuses on the development of the beer market in Greece, its great contribution to the national economy, the responsible investment on raw material and the support of the Greek farmers and producers. 

At the same time, Olympic Brewery is an example of a healthy Greek business overseas as it exports its high quality and tasty Greek beer to several dynamic international markets.

The 2 Brothers brewhouse has travelled all the way from New York City (Times Square) to Bayside Melbourne - Moorabbin Victoria.

On completion of the brewhouse construction, Dave and Andrew decided to share this showpiece brewing system with beer lovers and interested folk.

So a cosy bar and beer hall were constructed around the brewery floor, where patrons can enjoy 2 Brothers Beers, straight from the tank to the glass. 
2 Brothers Brewery was awarded Champion Trophies in 2010 and 2011 for the "Best Victorian Beer", Champion small Australian Brewery in 2013 as well as claiming Best Australian Pale Ale with 'Pay Day'and best reduced alcohol beer with 'Happiness'in 2017 (Australian International Beer Awards). 

The Brewery & Beer Hall is in it's own little pocket of Moorabbin. Serving fresh beer directly from the bright tanks and cooking up delicious eats every Thursday, Friday & Saturday
Brewing in New Zealand and United Kingdom.

For over 25 years, Anderson Valley Brewing Company has been hand-crafting authentic ales and lagers with balance and complexity and a passion for sustainable brewing practices. From our humble beginnings in our original 10-barrel brewhouse (located beneath the Buckhorn Saloon) to our current 100-barrel facility set on 26-acres of rolling hills and pastures just one mile from the center of Boonville, our commitment to quality and brewing excellence has never waned.  So whether youâre here to enjoy a pint in our beer garden, play some disc golf, or are just stopping by for a growler, weâre sure youâll agree thereâs no place like Anderson Valley. Welcome and Bahl Horninâ!

An industrial style brewery and bar that has 6 different beers on tap and a range of wood-fired pizzas. Your beer can be consumed in either our beer garden or surrounded by the stainless steel of our brewhouse. A pleasurable experience for everyone.

Opening Hours 
Thu, Fri 3-11pm 
Sat 12-late and Sun 12-9pm

Cheers...

Mountain Goat is a pioneer of Australiaâs craft beer scene, with the first beer â our Hightail amber ale - hitting pubs back in 1997. The brewery and Goat Bar still operate in the back streets of Richmond in Victoria with a lineup of old favourites on tap, brewery exclusives beers and cracking pizzas. 

From our Steam Ale, one of Australiaâs first organic beers; to our Summer Ale, a refreshing thirst-quencher available in cans and perfect for everything outdoors; through to our award-winning Rare Breeds and Barrel Breeds, limited in number but unrestrained in flavour, technique and creativity.  

We open the brewery to public every Wednesday and Friday nights from 5pm and Sunday afternoons. We usually have something special to the brewery on tap and cook rockinâ pizzas (we cater for vegetarians, vegans and our gluten-intolerant friends too). On Wednesday nights we hold free brewery tours at 6.30 â no need to book, just sign up at the bar.

Hardworking. Passionate. Original. Innovators. Thatâs how we describe the people of Humboldt County, California, and we sought out to capture that pioneering spirit in a bottle. In a glass. On tap. In the worldâs best brewed beer.

As avid home-brewers, co-owners Ted Vivatson and Margaret Frigon had a vision of excellent hand-crafted beer and great food in historic surroundings. The vision came to fruition in 1995 and the beer began to flow at the former site of the Clay Brown Redwood lumber mill in Fortuna, California.
 
Remnants of the old mill can still be seen in our beer garden, one of the best places to enjoy some of the best beer on a sunny day. Inside the Pub you'll see historic photographs of the mill and various other Humboldt County scenes from days gone by.

Although we've moved our brewing facility up river to the site of another historic mill in Scotia, California, small batches of specialty beers are still brewed at the Pub and Restaurant in Fortuna.

Baird Beer is a celebratory experience in flavor. The basic formula for the entire lineup of hand-crafted Baird Beer is the same: Balance + Complexity = Character. The brewers of Baird Beer are dedicated to the crafting of beer that bursts with flavor and character. Baird Beer is produced in small batches with painstaking care, passion and reverence for tradition.

Cricketers Arms was created in 2009 by Paul Scott as a tribute to his father. As a boy he would watch on as his father played cricket and shared beers with the opposing team post-match. With Scottâs passion as a publican and the experience and expertise of brewer Dermot OâDonnell, a contemporary, flavoursome and quality beer was born. Cricketers Arms is an approachable brand with a strong sense of traditional values: helping mates, playing hard, losing gracefully, having a laugh and taking pride in yourself and the community. Cricketers Arms honours friendships and celebrates communities.

Nail Brewing upgraded to a 50 HL DME brewhouse in 2012 after being a gypsy brewer for 8 years. Nail Brewing started with the first pint of Nail Ale being poured in March 2000 in Perth's CBD. Operations stopped in 2004 after a bad accident. 

Nail Brewing - awarded by judges and loved by locals since 2000.
Where ancient alchemy meets modern day science to create the best tasting beer on the planet.

items.brewery_name: Florida Ice and Farm Company S.A.

breweries.brewery_description:
As the man who first successfully cultivated hops in Australia way back in the early 19th century, James Squire has achieved legendary status. Chuck Hahn is a man after James Squireâs heart, a passionate brewer who has made a significant impact on the beer-drinking landscape.

In 1988, Chuck Hahn converted a former furniture factory into the Hahn Brewery. Ten years later, the brewery was renamed The Malt Shovel Brewery, which takes its name from James Squireâs original brewing tavern âThe Malt Shovelâ. We think itâs safe to say that James Squire would approve.

Located in Sydneyâs inner-city suburb of Camperdown, The Malt Shovel Brewery is home to a small team of expert brewers who, relying on minimal automation, experiment with hand-crafted, innovative brews. Together theyâve created instant classics for the James Squire range like One Fifty Lashes Pale Ale, The Chancer Golden Ale, Four Wives Pilsener, Stowaway IPA, Jack of Spades Porter and Hop Thief American-style Pale Ale.

You can almost taste the rich history and intense passion in each flavoursome drop. You can expect more outstanding craft beers in years to come from the team at The Malt Shovel Brewery who, just like James Squire before them, have an insatiable appetite to taste it all.
We strive to create the best handcrafted beer possible by using the best ingredients and pure Otway rainwater from the lush rainforest. Water is the key! Prost!

Throughout the years weâve produced some of Australiaâs favourite specialty beers & ciders, and along the way bagged a swag of trophies and awards. Our highly regarded Head Brewer â Scott Vincent â leads our brewing team with pride as they continue on the mission established in 1984 at the Sail & Anchor Hotel.

Based in Greenwich and fiercely proud of its London roots, Meantime has won a worldwide reputation for beers of great quality and provenance.

Meantime was the first British brewery to win any medals at the World Beer Cup in 2004 and has continued to do so since.

Our mission is to produce great beers in a variety of styles full of taste and flavour, we also provide the knowledge and understanding necessary to appreciate the Craft Beer culture and the beers that come from it.

Nearly 150 years brewing experience, Monteith's Brewing Company has become recognised as the leader in the New Zealand craft beer market. Our origins are firmly ingrained and our brewery is standing strong and proud.

We carefully hand craft our beers in small batches to develop the full natural flavours. When each batch is ready, we employ a time honoured tradition for quality control ... We taste it.

In 2002, our funky little Colorado grown brew-pub started stuffing our huge, voluminously hopped mutha of a pale ale in a can (Dale's Pale Ale). That not only began the craft-beer-in-a-can craze, but has grown to add a brewery to the hills of Pisgah National Forest in Brevard, NC and another in the Live Music Capital of the World, Austin, TX, in 2016. Cans keep beer fresher, longer by eliminating the damaging effects of light and ingressed oxygen while being infinitely recyclable and portable...taking them where your next soul saving adventure takes you.

Oskar Blues Brewery Longmont, ColoRADo
Oskar Blues Brewery - Brevard, North Carolina
Oskar Blues Brewery - Austin, Texas
Batch Brewing Company brews beer the traditional way, hand crafted and batch by batch. We brew for you Sydney.
